meanings.definition: To coat (a metal object) with a thin layer of a different metal by electrolysis.
meanings.sent1: I will electroplate this key to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will electroplate the ring with gold.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could electroplate a spoon with silver in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to electroplate the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays electroplate the water with a golden glow at sunset.

meanings.definition: An object that has been coated with a thin layer of a different metal by electrolysis.
meanings.sent1: The electroplate on the trophy was starting to wear off.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design on the electroplate.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a mysterious electroplate hidden in the attic.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an electroplate, hiding his true feelings underneath.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight turned the lake into a shimmering electroplate.
